page.title: 03FACILITIES FOR THE ELDERLY
page.content: Almost 25% of the population of Poulton is retired.This is much higher than the national average, and is reflected by the provision made for the elderly in living accommodation and facilities. In the centre of Poulton there is a day centre for old people.There are regular coffee mornings and whist drives,and in the afternoon,teas are provided as well as somewhere to talk. Also based in Poulton is a "Meals on Wheels" service, which operates daily. This is run by the W.R.V.S.,who run two vans provided by the local "Lions Club". There is a large number of old peoples homes-both nursing and rest homes. This seems to be a "growth industry" in the area. One of the largest places is Queensway Lodge, near the Day Centre.
